description: The user asks for a historical comparison of today’s tech headlines versus the same day last year. The assistant fetches RSS feeds, extracts article contents, summarizes them, ranks the summaries against the user’s tech interests, and returns a concise comparison of the top headlines from both dates.

messages.content: You are an AI assistant for a personalized news digest service. You have access to tools for fetching RSS feeds, extracting article content, summarizing articles, ranking them against a user interest profile, and sending email digests.
I’d like a historical comparison: today’s tech headlines vs. the same day last year.
Sure! I’ll gather the latest tech headlines for today and for the same calendar date last year, summarize the top articles, and give you a side‑by‑side comparison.

{"articles": [{"title": "AI breakthrough beats human performance in language tasks", "link": "https://example.com/articles/ai-breakthrough", "publish_date": "2024-12-07"}, {"title": "Quantum computing chip reaches 1,000 qubits", "link": "https://example.com/articles/quantum-chip", "publish_date": "2024-12-07"}]}

{"articles": [{"title": "Self‑driving cars hit 1 million miles on public roads", "link": "https://example.com/articles/self-driving", "publish_date": "2023-12-07"}, {"title": "5G rollout accelerates across Europe", "link": "https://example.com/articles/5g-rollout", "publish_date": "2023-12-07"}]}
Got the feeds. I’ll now download the four articles to extract their main text.
Full text of the AI breakthrough article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the quantum computing chip article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the self‑driving cars article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the 5G rollout article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Now I’ll generate three‑sentence summaries for each article.

arguments.text: Full text of the AI breakthrough article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the quantum computing chip article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the self‑driving cars article… (content trimmed for brevity)
Full text of the 5G rollout article… (content trimmed for brevity)

messages.content: Researchers unveiled an AI model that outperforms humans on a suite of language benchmarks, citing advances in transformer scaling and new training data pipelines.
A new quantum processor hit the 1,000‑qubit mark, promising exponential speed‑ups for chemistry simulations and opening doors for error‑corrected quantum computing.
Autonomous vehicles collectively logged their one‑millionth mile on public roads, showing a safety record comparable to human drivers in mixed traffic.
Europe accelerated its 5G rollout, with nine new countries launching commercial services and mobile operators reporting a 35 % increase in subscriber uptake.
I’ll rank the summaries according to a typical tech‑enthusiast profile (keywords: AI, quantum, autonomous, 5G).

summaries: Researchers unveiled an AI model that outperforms humans on a suite of language benchmarks, citing advances in transformer scaling and new training data pipelines.
A new quantum processor hit the 1,000‑qubit mark, promising exponential speed‑ups for chemistry simulations and opening doors for error‑corrected quantum computing.
Autonomous vehicles collectively logged their one‑millionth mile on public roads, showing a safety record comparable to human drivers in mixed traffic.
Europe accelerated its 5G rollout, with nine new countries launching commercial services and mobile operators reporting a 35 % increase in subscriber uptake.

messages.content: {"ranked": [{"summary": "Researchers unveiled an AI model that outperforms humans on a suite of language benchmarks, citing advances in transformer scaling and new training data pipelines.", "score": 0.94}, {"summary": "A new quantum processor hit the 1,000‑qubit mark, promising exponential speed‑ups for chemistry simulations and opening doors for error‑corrected quantum computing.", "score": 0.88}]}

{"ranked": [{"summary": "Autonomous vehicles collectively logged their one‑millionth mile on public roads, showing a safety record comparable to human drivers in mixed traffic.", "score": 0.91}, {"summary": "Europe accelerated its 5G rollout, with nine new countries launching commercial services and mobile operators reporting a 35 % increase in subscriber uptake.", "score": 0.85}]}

### Historical Comparison – Tech Headlines

**Today (2024‑12‑07)**
1. **AI breakthrough beats human performance** – Researchers unveiled an AI model that outperforms humans on a suite of language benchmarks, citing advances in transformer scaling and new training data pipelines. *(Score: 0.94)*
2. **Quantum computing chip reaches 1,000 qubits** – A new quantum processor hit the 1,000‑qubit mark, promising exponential speed‑ups for chemistry simulations and opening doors for error‑corrected quantum computing. *(Score: 0.88)*

**Same Day Last Year (2023‑12‑07)**
1. **Self‑driving cars hit 1 million miles on public roads** – Autonomous vehicles collectively logged their one‑millionth mile on public roads, showing a safety record comparable to human drivers in mixed traffic. *(Score: 0.91)*
2. **5G rollout accelerates across Europe** – Europe accelerated its 5G rollout, with nine new countries launching commercial services and mobile operators reporting a 35 % increase in subscriber uptake. *(Score: 0.85)*

**Takeaway:** 2024’s top stories lean heavily toward frontier AI and quantum hardware breakthroughs, while the same date a year ago highlighted the maturation of autonomous vehicle deployments and the expansion of 5G infrastructure.
